meanings.definition: The process of developing or unfolding as if coming into flower.
meanings.sent1: The garden was full of beautiful efflorescences, each one blooming in its own time.
meanings.sent2: In spring, the trees burst into efflorescences, painting the landscape with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: The efflorescences in the garden seemed to be having a race to see who could bloom the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like a field of efflorescences, constantly growing and evolving.
meanings.sent5: The efflorescences in her artwork were so intricate and detailed, they seemed almost alive.

meanings.definition: A powdery substance that forms on the surface of a mineral as it weathers.
meanings.sent1: The old statue was covered in efflorescences, giving it a weathered and ancient look.
meanings.sent2: After years of exposure to the elements, the rock was covered in a layer of efflorescences.
meanings.sent3: The archaeologist joked that the efflorescences on the artifact made it look like it had a powdered wig.
meanings.sent4: The efflorescences on the mineral sparkled in the sunlight, like tiny diamonds scattered on its surface.
meanings.sent5: The efflorescences on the stone were a reminder of the passage of time and the effects of nature's touch.
